qas.question: Who won season two of American Idol?
Who came in second on season two of American Idol?
What year did Vote for the Worst cease operations?
How many more text votes were there in season eight of American Idol over season seven?
Which season had the biggest voting controversy?
Which season had a voting controversy because of a huge increase in text votes?
Which voting concern has been present since the first season?
When did Vote for the Girls start?
When did Vote for the Worst close?

context: Voting results have been a consistent source of controversy. The mechanism of voting had also aroused considerable criticisms, most notably in <a4_0>season two<a4_0/> when <a0_0>Ruben Studdard<a0_0/> beat <a1_0>Clay Aiken<a1_0/> in a close vote, and in <a5_0>season eight<a5_0/>, when the massive increase in text votes (<a3_0>100 million<a3_0/> more text votes than season 7) fueled the texting controversy. Concerns about <a6_0>power voting<a6_0/> have been expressed from the very first season. Since 2004, votes also have been affected to a limited degree by online communities such as DialIdol, Vote for the Worst (closed in <a2_0><a8_0>2013<a8_0/><a2_0/>), and Vote for the Girls (started <a7_0>2010<a7_0/>).
